Italy: Constantius died at Eboracum. By his dying wish, his troops acclaimed his son Constantine the Great augustus. Galerius recognized Flavius Valerius Severus as augustus in the west and granted Constantine the Great the lesser title of Caesar, which he accepted. Civil wars of the Tetrarchy: Rioters in Rome acclaimed Maximian's son Maxentius ruler of Rome. He took the title princeps invictus, undefeated prince. Maxentius invited Maximian to reclaim the title augustus.
